alert.note: Alert for Custer; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 8:18PM CDT until June 02 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Washita River near Clinton affecting Washita and Custer Counties.
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC039-149-021330- /O.CON.KOUN.FL.Y.0018.000000T0000Z-220602T1800Z/ /CLIO2.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 818 PM CDT Wed Jun 1 2022 ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Washita River near Clinton. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Shallow overflows occur only to rural lands along the Washita River valley... from areas near the mouth of Barnitz Creek... to near Clinton in Custer County... and downstream to near the town of Cloud Chief in Washita County. Greater depths could occur in areas where smaller streams enter the Washita River valley. Some farmsteads may be isolated by water over local roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The Washita River is expected to rise to a crest of 17.8 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
